content.raw:
~~I am afraid `gdal` support is not enabled in the gazebo vcpkg port proposed in [https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/8178/files](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/8178/files) .~~

I realized only later that `gdal` is not a compile time dependency of Gazebo.
content.html:
I am afraid gdal support is not enabled in the gazebo vcpkg port proposed in https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/8178/files .

I realized only later that gdal is not a compile time dependency of Gazebo.

content.raw:
Now that [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129) has been merged, only this modifications is required to actually compile Gazebo against Ogre 1.12 @stjust .   
When  compiled with Ogre < 1.11, the modification is ABI compatible. I was not able to actually run the version with this modifications so I am not sure about the runtime impact.

 @stjust Just in case, did you tried the vcpkg’s Gazebo \(that includes this patch\) with Heightmaps?

‌
content.html:
Now that #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129 has been merged, only this modifications is required to actually compile Gazebo against Ogre 1.12 @stjust .
When compiled with Ogre < 1.11, the modification is ABI compatible. I was not able to actually run the version with this modifications so I am not sure about the runtime impact.

@stjust Just in case, did you tried the vcpkg’s Gazebo (that includes this patch) with Heightmaps?

‌

pull_request.title: Change gazebo rendering Heightmap class to compile with Ogre 1.11/1.12

pullrequest.title: Change gazebo rendering Heightmap class to compile with Ogre 1.11/1.12

content.raw:
This PR builds on the top of [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129) . The relevant commit is [https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-21/commits/152a77d545b2e51cf7809760558578df36331b52?at=gazebo10](https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-21/commits/152a77d545b2e51cf7809760558578df36331b52?at=gazebo10) .

This modification is in a separate commit because it is not a simple change of API of Ogre, but a more substantial change \(done only if OGRE is >= 1.11\).  
This modification is necessary because since OGRE 1.11, the once public Ogre::TerrainMaterialGeneratorA::SM2Profile::ShaderHelper  
class and its descent are now private classes of OGRE, see

\* [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/master/Docs/1.11-Notes.md#other](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/master/Docs/1.11-Notes.md#other)

\* [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/722/commits/88d6903a0b6e3d47d477f2a18ea755804f990a2f](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/722/commits/88d6903a0b6e3d47d477f2a18ea755804f990a2f)

As these classes are heavily used in the Heightmap class implementation \(by accessing a protected Ogre pointer\) we need to disable the definition of the custom terrain generator,  
and just use the Ogre default one instead. While all the tests passes with this modification, I guess that the test do not cover the the actual rendering of the Heightmap, that is probably   
impacted by this change.
content.html:
This PR builds on the top of #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3129 . The relevant commit is https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-21/commits/152a77d545b2e51cf7809760558578df36331b52?at=gazebo10 .

This modification is in a separate commit because it is not a simple change of API of Ogre, but a more substantial change (done only if OGRE is >= 1.11).
This modification is necessary because since OGRE 1.11, the once public Ogre::TerrainMaterialGeneratorA::SM2Profile::ShaderHelper
class and its descent are now private classes of OGRE, see

* https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/master/Docs/1.11-Notes.md#other

* https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/722/commits/88d6903a0b6e3d47d477f2a18ea755804f990a2f

As these classes are heavily used in the Heightmap class implementation (by accessing a protected Ogre pointer) we need to disable the definition of the custom terrain generator,
and just use the Ogre default one instead. While all the tests passes with this modification, I guess that the test do not cover the the actual rendering of the Heightmap, that is probably
impacted by this change.
